title: Croatia switches to euro
description: At midnight, on Sunday, the Balkan nation bid farewell to its kuna currency and became the 20th member of the eurozone. Experts say the adoption of the euro will help shield Croatia's economy at a time when inflation is soaring worldwide.

title: North Korea opens New Year with missile launch
description: Pyongyang fired a short-range ballistic missile toward its eastern waters Sunday, entering 2023 with another weapons test after an unprecedented number of missile firings last year.

title: Russian strikes intensify as Ukrainians return for holiday
description: Russian strikes on Saturday targeted Ukraine, including the capital Kyiv, just hours before New Year's Eve celebrations while President Vladimir Putin told Russians that 'historical rightness' was on their side.

title: Islamic State claims deadly attack in Egypt Suez Canal city
description: Three Egyptian policemen were killed in the attack on Friday, the first of its kind in nearly three years in mainland Egypt, which has largely been spared the deadly insurgency in the nearby Sinai peninsula.

title: Benedict XVI and Francis: Two popes under one roof
description: The German pontiff's resignation in February 2013 created a new status, that of pope emeritus. But Benedict XVI has not always managed to remain in the shadow of his Argentine successor.

title: In Israel, calls to censor a film on the crimes of the Nakba
description: The authorities and part of the Israeli public have vehemently criticized 'Farha,' a film that shows soldiers shooting a Palestinian family that was forced to flee.

title: Photographer Tom Sandberg showed the world in powerful black and white
description: A pioneer of art photography in Scandinavia, the Norwegian, who passed away in 2014, left behind a mesmerizing body of work. For the first time, there is a monograph dedicated to him.

title: In Argentina, foreigners are won over by the Albiceleste's World Cup victory
description: Many of Argentina's 2.2 million immigrants supported the team's journey, a collective euphoria testifying to the ease of integration granted to South Americans, even though discrimination remains.

title: Pelé's final return to Santos, the city where he built his legend as a footballer
description: Edson Arantes do Nascimento will be buried on Tuesday, January 3, in the southern Brazilian city mourning its 'king.'

title: Pensions, inflation, climate: Macron is heading for a 2023 full of uncertainties
description: The French president will present his traditional message to the French on Saturday, December 31, for a new year that promises to be fraught on the economic and social fronts.

title: On both sides of the aisle, seniors run American politics
description: The presidency, Senate and Supreme Court are becoming less representative of wider society, age-wise. Nearly half of Americans are under 40, but only 5% of Congress is in this age group.

title: Vivienne Westwood, British designer and activist, dies age 81
description: Between a remarkable mastery of couture, provocative appeal and irreverent and joyful femininity, the designer never stopped questioning the established order. She died on December 29, at the age of 81.

title: Brazilian plantations accused of forced labor supply Europe with sugar
description: Nivea, Tereos, LDC, Sucden: These companies are major purchasers of sugar or ethanol supplied from Brazil, in places where modern slavery and aggravated pollution are said to be rampant.

title: Death of Benedict XVI: Former pope often had strained relations with other faiths
description: The former pope, who died on December 31, 2022, at the age of 95, was a champion of ecumenism but caused much controversy among Protestants, Jews and Muslims.

title: Benedict XVI, reluctant pope and conservative theologian, dies aged 95
description: Joseph Ratzinger, elected in 2005, was the first pope of the modern era to voluntarily step down. He died on December 31, 2022, at his Vatican residence.

title: Sweden takes over Council of the European Union presidency, with little enthusiasm
description: On January 1, the Scandinavian kingdom takes over the rotating presidency from the Czech Republic, as the government deals with its coalition partner on the eurosceptic far right.

title: For the French economy, the worst may be avoided in 2023
description: The year ahead looks uncertain as inflation takes hold and growth is expected to decline.

title: Paap Seen: 'The former colonizer continues to show arrogance toward Africans'
description: 'From Dakar to Djibouti, a tour of the Africa-France relationship' (1/11). The Senegalese journalist predicts that part of Africa's youth will increasingly reject of France.

title: Assisted dying, euthanasia, end of life: French experts to develop glossary ahead of legislation
description: Legal experts, scientists and writers are working to deliver a glossary related to the topic by March, at the government's request.

title: Russia in a legislative frenzy as Ukraine conflict drags on
description: The Duma, usually the home to mere formalities, recorded the most active year in its recent history.

title: Barbara Walters, television news trailblazer, dies at 93
description: Walters was famous for plying notable public figures with pointed questions during on air interviews as part of her decorated broadcast career.

title: Le Monde's favorite films of 2022: 'Pacifiction', 'Armageddon Time', 'Licorice Pizza', and more
description: Our seven film journalists look back at the feature films that made the biggest impression on them this year.

title: Idaho college murder suspect is criminology PhD student
description: DNA evidence played a key role in identifying Bryan Christopher Kohberger as a suspect in the killings. He was arrested on Friday.

title: Contemporary art: Africa benefits from a new exhibition space in Paris
description: The Christophe Person gallery has just opened in Paris' Marais district and is showing the work of two young Cameroonian artists: Manga Lulu Williams and Wilfried Mbida.

title: Guy Delisle: 'If I can get more than two words out of my teens, that's a win'
description: 'Life as a Parent.' Comic strip author Guy Delisle has explored the joys and setbacks of daily life with his children in his graphic novels, recounting the changes in the relationship between parents and children over the years.

title: Xi Jinping evades Vladimir Putin's proposals to strengthen military cooperation with China
description: The Chinese and Russian presidents met on Friday by video. The reports of the exchange between the two men betray a significant difference of views on the conflict in Ukraine.
